plugins.name: Apply modes to all pages
plugins.description:
This plugin works by replicating the current page selected variable modes to every other page of the document.


Instructions

  1. Set the desired modes in the current page.
  2. While in the page, run the plugin.
  3. Check the other pages to see if the modes were applied correctly.


Useful information:

  1. The plugin will replace modes within the same collection.
  2. The plugin will not remove modes. If a page has an additional collection that is not in the current page, it will keep it.
  3. For large files, it might take a little while for the plugin to finish running, wait for a message saying ”✨ All done! ✨”. It might also take a while for the file to finish uploading.
plugins.tagline: Replicate Current Page Mode in all pages of the document

104411.name: Apply modes to all pages

  3. For large files, it might take a little while for the plugin to finish running, wait for a message saying ”✨ All done! ✨”. It might also take a while for the file to finish uploading.
104411.tagline: Replicate Current Page Mode in all pages of the document

plugins.name: Quick Section
plugins.description:
Features

  1. Create sections without manually changing colors each time.
  2. Add headers to organize your frames horizontally or vertically.
  3. Access features through the UI or quick menu actions.
  4. Set up keyboard shortcuts to perform quick menu actions faster.


How it works

  1. Select the layers you want to organize.
  2. Click an option from the UI or run it from the plugin menu.
  3. Sections and headers are created and aligned to your selections.


Alternatively, you can add sections or headers directly on the canvas without selecting any layers.
plugins.tagline: Create sections and e

104131.name: Quick Section
104131.description:

  2. Add headers to organize your frames horizontally or vertically.
  3. Access features through the UI or quick menu actions.

How it works

  1. Select the layers you want to organize.
  2. Click an option from the UI or run it from the plugin menu.
  3. Sections and headers are created and aligned to your selections.


Alternatively, you can add sections or headers directly on the canvas without selecting any layers.
104131.release_notes:
Change header text size to 96
Changed vertical header text width to fill

plugins.name: HCT Variablinator
plugins.description:
HCT Variablinator generates a color palette following Google's HCT color theory. It can then create a Figma Variables collection with all the tones created. You can then reference these through Aliases in your other collections.


Future features:

  1. Mode support - create new modes with same tokens to support different brands / themes
  2. Code gen for theming using style-dictionary for plug and play
plugins.tagline: Variablinate your HCT scales for brands and themes

105400.name: HCT Variablinator
105400.description:

  2. Code gen for theming using style-dictionary for plug and play
105400.tagline: Variablinate your HCT scales for brands and themes

plugins.name: Tint Smith
plugins.description:
TintSmith - Figma Color Scheme Plugin


Perfect for designers looking to jazz up their color palettes faster than you can say "magenta"!


Usage:


  1. Choose and name your color: Name your color or let the plugin flex its creative muscles with the Auto generate name option. Who knows, it might just name your color "Sassy Salmon"!
  2. Apply Color Schemes: Check Generate local styles to sprinkle those fancy color schemes onto your Figma Color Styles. It’s like magic, but with colors.
  3. Get Contrast Colors: For contrast colors from black and white, check Include contrast values. Your designs will thank you for the extra pop!
  4. Apply Styles: Click on Apply styles and watch your design transform into a visual masterpiece.


Have fun! ☕

Nathyane 😊
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly blend colors to enhance your design brilliance.

92650.name: Tint Smith
92650.description:
TintSmith - Figma Color Scheme Plugin


Perfect for designers looking to jazz up their color palettes faster than you can say "magenta"!

  2. Apply Color Schemes: Check Generate local styles to sprinkle those fancy color schemes onto your Figma Color Styles. It’s like magic, but with colors.
  3. Get Contrast Colors: For contrast colors from black and white, check Include contrast values. Your designs will thank you for the extra pop!
  4. Apply Styles: Click on Apply styles and watch your design transform into a visual masterpiece.


Have fun! ☕

Nathyane 😊
92650.tagline: Effortlessly blend colors to enhance your design brilliance.

plugins.name: multiple borders
plugins.description:
multiple borders is an easy-to-use Figma plugin that lets you add multiple borders (strokes) to vector shapes and elements.


with multiple borders, you can:

  1. create complex layered border designs
  2. customize each border's color, weight, and type
  3. enhance design flexibility for icons, buttons, and graphic elements
  4. streamline the process of creating intricate border effects


if you have feedback or run into any bugs, dm me on twitter @coleschfr :)


happy designing!
plugins.tagline: add multiple borders to any vector or element

plugins.name: Stronde for Email – Figma Images in Mobile & Dark-Mode HTML Emails (ESP Integration: HubSpot, Klaviy
plugins.description:
What is Stronde for Email’s Figma Plugin?

The Stronde for Email Figma Plugin lets you export Figma images directly into Stronde for Email and/or your ESP (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Marketo, HubSpot, Klaviyo, and more). These images are then added to HTML emails, already optimized for mobile and dark mode.


Stronde for Email is a powerful email creation platform designed to simplify email design and collaboration for marketing teams, agencies, and enterprises. It enables teams to build, approve, and sync marketing emails seamlessly across platforms.


📌 Learn more about our customers: strondeforemail.com/customers/

📌 Explore our integrations: strondeforemail.com/integrations/

📌 Discover Stronde for Email features: strondeforemail.com/


Why Use Stronde for Email’s Figma Plugin?

  1. 🚀 One-click export – Send Figma images directly to Stronde for Email.
  2. 🔄 ESP Integration – Supports Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Oracle Eloqua, Marketo, HubSpot, MailChimp, Klaviyo, and more.
  3. 🎨 Supports any type of graphic – As long as it fits within the dimensions set, export with ease.


How Does It Work?

  1. Create your visuals in Figma.
  2. Export images directly to Stronde for Email. If integrated with your ESP, you’ll also find them in your ESP’s media library.
  3. Use them in the HTML email templates available—fully optimized for mobile and dark mode.
  4. Send high-performing emails without needing to manually download, upload, and test images in your ESP.


Features

✅ Direct Figma-to-ESP export – Save time with seamless workflow integration.

✅ Optimized for HTML emails – Ensure images fit and render correctly in email clients.

✅ ESP-ready – Works with Salesforce, Pardot, Marketo, HubSpot, Klaviyo, and more.

✅ Cloud-based storage – Organize images in the Stronde for Email library.

✅ Perfect for agencies & teams – Anyone can use it, from designers to marketers.


📌 See how teams use Stronde for Email: strondeforemail.com/customers/


FAQ

How does this help with HTML email optimization?

  1. The plugin automatically compresses, scales, and formats images correctly for HTML email campaigns
  2. Images are never too big or too small, so you don’t have to double-check file requirements before launching campaigns.


Does this require coding knowledge?

  1. No! Simply export images from Figma and use them in your email templates—no developer needed.


Is this free to use?

  1. The plugin itself is free, but you’ll need a paid Stronde for Email subscription to access full HTML email functionalities.


What ESPs does the Stronde for Email support?

  1. Stronde for Email integrates with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Oracle Eloqua, Marketo, HubSpot, Klaviyo, MailChimp, and more.


📌 Check out all Stronde for Email integrations: strondeforemail.com/integrations/

accepted.name: Stronde for Email
accepted.description: Stronde for Email is a no-code email creation platform designed for enterprise organizations and agencies. It enables teams to create on-brand marketing emails

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly export Figma images into mobile and dark-mode optimized HTML emails, ready for your ESP

plugins.name: Frame Presets
plugins.description:
This free plugin allows the user to create frames with a specified name, width, and height in the 'Create New Preset' tab. The user can then scroll through their presets in the 'View & Alter Presets' tab or use the search bar for their convenience. Additionally, in the 'View & Alter Presets' tab by clicking on the preset's name the user will be able to confirm the preset's information and apply that frame within their Figma file. Each preset also provides the user with the option to edit its parameters or delete it from local memory.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/cuddlybeast
plugins.tagline: Create, delete, edit, and apply your own custom frame presets.

113208.name: Frame Presets
113208.description:

The user can then scroll through their presets in the 'View & Alter Presets' tab or use the search bar for their convenience. Additionally, in the 'View & Alter Presets' tab by clicking on the preset's name the user will be able to confirm the preset's information and apply that frame within their Figma file. Each preset also provides the user with the option to edit its parameters or delete it from local memory.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/cuddlybeast
113208.tagline: Create, delete, edit, and apply your own custom frame presets.

plugins.name: Select and Inspect
plugins.description:
Why?


If you ever implemented a Figma plugin, you know how slow the process of inspecting specific properties (among the hundreds available) and values in a Figma file is.


This plugin aims to solve this problem by making logging as easy as possible!


Features

  1. Select one or more Figma elements to get them logged in the Console
  2. Add expressions to be evaluated on the selected Figma elements (name,id,reactions[0].actions results in each expression to be evaluated and logged in the Console)
  3. Stringy and format the result for better readability
  4. Preferences are stored locally


FAQ

Why not using the existing "Inspector" plugin?

Because the properties must be added to the UI by the plugin's author, limiting the plugin's scalability (as you can see in the reviews).
plugins.tagline: Select an item and get it logged in Console

84365.name: Select and Inspect
84365.description:

84365.release_notes: Invoke evaluated expressions if they are functions and await the returned promises if needed
84365.tagline: Select an item and get it logged in Console

plugins.name: Variable Search
plugins.description:
Figma's Variables previously couldn’t be searched directly, which made it difficult when managing multiple collections and numerous variables.

But now, with the variable search feature, you can easily find and edit variables!


If you encounter any issues while using the plugin or have feedback, feel free to reach out anytime.

contact: plustypo@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: You can find each collection by searching for its variable.

plugins.name: MultiSelect Plus
plugins.description:
MultiSelect Plus helps you select multiple layers faster and easier than ever before.


Key Features:

• Select multiple layers as search criteria

• Find matching layers across your entire document

• Support for all layer types including shapes, components, and text


Perfect for designers working with:

• Repetitive element structures

• Batch updates and modifications

• Design file cleanup and organization


How to Use:

1. Select any layer on your canvas

2. Add more Layers to use it as your search criteria

3. Click "Find & Select" to highlight all matching layers

4. Use the history panel to quickly reuse


Boost your workflow efficiency by selecting exactly what you need in seconds!
plugins.tagline: Do something that goes beyond "selecting matching layers”

plugins.name: Hue Converter
plugins.description:
Hue converter plugin uses color formulas to correct color deviation issues on the in-vehicle screen and ensure consistency between the design and the in-vehicle screen colors.


You can select a single element or the entire interface, scan it, convert individual colors or all of them, and even convert the colors of the entire page.
plugins.tagline: Uses color formulas to correct color deviation issues on the in-vehicle screen

107922.name: Hue Converter
107922.description:
Hue converter plugin uses color formulas to correct color deviation issues on the in-vehicle screen and ensure consistency between the design and the in-vehicle screen colors.


You can select a single element or the entire interface, scan it, convert individual colors or all of them, and even convert the colors of the entire page.
107922.tagline: Uses color formulas to correct color deviation issues on the in-vehicle screen

plugins.name: Gridder
plugins.description:
A simple tool to generate grids and/or sort layers in ascending or descending layer name order.


How to use


Sorting: Select a group of layers, then select the sort direction.

Gridding: Select a group of layers, then select either the column count or row count. Then adjust the spacing values.


Combine the two use for rapid organized grid creation and maintenance.


From yours truly,

Ryan Nono
plugins.tagline: A simple tool to generate grids and/or sort layers in ascending or descending layer name order.

104536.name: Gridder

From yours truly,

104536.tagline: A simple tool to generate grids and/or sort layers in ascending or descending layer name order.

plugins.name: Bootstrap Icons Search Plugin for Figma | Free & Fast
plugins.description:
🚀 Supercharge your Figma designs with instant access to over 2,000 free Bootstrap Icons!


The Bootstrap Icons Search plugin empowers you to effortlessly browse, search, and insert any icon from the comprehensive Bootstrap Icons library—right within Figma.


🎯 Key Features:


🔎 Comprehensive Icon Library: Access the complete Bootstrap Icons collection, featuring over 2,000 free SVG icons.


⚡ Powerful Search Functionality: Quickly find the perfect icon using intuitive keyword search.


🎨 One-Click Insertion: Easily insert icons into your designs with a single click.


🧭 User-Friendly Interface: Navigate and utilize the plugin with ease, thanks to its intuitive design.


🧩 Design Consistency: Maintain a cohesive look by using icons that align with Bootstrap's design standards.


Ideal for designers and teams aiming to accelerate their design process and uphold UI consistency with Bootstrap standards.

plugins.name: Optimize Images for Web
plugins.description:
Optimize Images for Web streamlines your entire image export workflow:


  1. Batch-optimize & export: Process every image on a page at once, then download them as a ZIP.
  2. Global compression & resize: Dial in a single set of quality and dimension settings that apply to all assets.
  3. Flexible formats: Choose PNG, WebP, or JPEG output to suit any platform or use case.
  4. Consistent renaming: Automatically rename exports in kebab-case or snake_case for tidy, predictable filenames.


With just a few clicks, you’ll have web-ready images — optimized, resized, correctly named, and packaged — without ever leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Batch-optimize, compress, rename, and export web-ready images (webp).

131892.name: Optimize Images for Web
131892.description:
Optimize Images for Web streamlines your entire image export workflow:


  1. Batch-optimize & export: Process every image on a page at once, then download them as a ZIP.
  2. Global compression & resize: Dial in a single set of quality and dimension settings that apply to all assets.
  3. Flexible formats: Choose PNG, WebP, or JPEG output to suit any platform or use case.
  4. Consistent renaming: Automatically rename exports in kebab-case or snake_case for tidy, predictable filenames.


With just a few clicks, you’ll have web-ready images — optimized, resized, correctly named, and packaged — without ever leaving Figma.
131892.tagline: Batch-optimize, compress, rename, and export web-ready images (webp).

plugins.name: Rename Code Syntax (Web/iOS/Android)
plugins.description:
Convert Figma variables to developer-ready code syntax in one click!


Features


🚀 Platform-specific outputs:


  1. Web: var(--color-primary) (CSS)
  2. iOS: colorPrimary (Swift)
  3. Android: color_primary (Kotlin/XML)


🔧 Customization:


  1. Add prefixes like color- or btn-
  2. Choose word dividers (-, _, or custom)
  3. Override default formats (kebab/camel/snake case)


🛠️ Smart formatting:


  1. Handles spaces and special characters (e.g., /)
  2. Works across variable collections
  3. Dark/light mode support


Why developers and designers love it:


  1. Saves hours of manual renaming
  2. Ensures naming consistency across platforms
  3. Perfect for design system maintenance


Usage Instructions


1- Select a variable collection

2- Choose your target platform (Web/iOS/Android)

3- Customize formatting (optional):

  1. Prefix: Add a prefix like color-
  2. Divider: Replace spaces// with -, _, etc.
  3. Format: Override default platform formats

4- Click "Update Variables" – done!


Support & Feedback

"Found a bug? Have feature requests? Reach out at gmazzo@gmail.com


Privacy Notes

"This plugin does NOT collect user data or connect to external servers."
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma variables to developer-ready code syntax in one click!

plugins.name: Color Palette Generator
plugins.description:
🎨 Color Palette Generator – Your Ultimate Color Companion for Figma


Effortlessly create stunning and harmonious color palettes with the enhanced Color Palette Generator. Whether you’re designing for web, mobile, or branding, this plugin offers everything you need from simple color schemes to complex, accessible palettes.


💡 Key Features:


🎯 Palette Generation:

  1. Generate palettes by keyword, random, triadic, analogous, complementary, split-complementary, tetradic, or warm soothing pastels.
  2. Explore color harmony with an interactive color wheel and adjustable saturation/lightness sliders.
  3. Extract colors from images with customizable settings for color count, threshold, and brightness.


⚡ Palette Management:

  1. Apply palettes directly to Figma layers.
  2. Save, load, and delete palettes for future use.


🧑‍💻 Accessibility & Simulation:

  1. Accessibility Check for WCAG contrast compliance.
  2. Color Blindness Simulation (Protanopia, Deuteranopia, Tritanopia) for inclusive design.


🌟 Enhanced UI Experience:

  1. Tabs for basic, pro and image features.
  2. Dark Mode support for seamless design workflows.
  3. User Notifications for real-time feedback.


💥 Design smarter, faster, and more inclusively directly in Figma.


Enhance your design process and craft stunning color combinations with the Color Palette Generator plugin!
plugins.tagline: Effortless color harmony for your designs—generate, apply, and export palettes in one click!

plugins.name: Text Calculator
plugins.description:
Text Calculator allows Figma users to perform mathematical operations directly within text layers.


The plugin keeps the text layer's original styles intact, including fonts and applied text styles.


To use, simply select a text layer, type your formula (e.g., 5+5), and click the "Calculate" button.


Perfect for designers needing quick calculations while maintaining design consistency.

plugins.name: Figma To Rust
plugins.description:
Figma To Rust Plugin Export

Streamline your design-to-development workflow with the Figma To Rust Plugin Export. This powerful plugin bridges the gap between your creative designs in Figma and the robust interface code needed for Rust plugins.


Features:

  1. Seamless Export: Easily export your Figma sketches directly into interface code tailored for Rust plugins.
  2. Time-Saving: Reduce the manual effort required to translate designs into code, allowing you to focus more on creativity and functionality.
  3. Consistent Design: Ensure that your Rust plugin interfaces maintain the same visual fidelity as your original Figma designs.
  4. Easy Integration: Integrate the exported code effortlessly into your existing Rust projects, making it a breeze to update and iterate on your designs.


How It Works:

  1. Design in Figma: Create your interface designs using Figma's intuitive tools.
  2. Export with Plugin: Use the Figma To Rust Plugin Export to convert your designs into Rust-compatible interface code.
  3. Implement in Rust: Import the generated code into your Rust project and start building your plugin with a solid visual foundation.


Ideal For:

  1. Developers looking to accelerate the development process for Rust plugins.
  2. Designers who want to ensure their designs are accurately represented in the final product.
  3. Teams seeking to improve collaboration between design and development phases.


Experience the efficiency and accuracy of the Figma To Rust Plugin Export today and elevate your plugin development process to new heights!
plugins.tagline: Allows you to export your sketches from Figma to interface code for Rust plugins

plugins.description:
Welcome to creating variables supaa fast!


Say goodbye to repetitive tasks and manual adjustments. With our plugin, you can create variables effortlessly across your designs, saving valuable time and effort. Focus on the creative aspects of your work while we handle the tedious parts.


How to Use:

  1. Run the Plugin
  2. Select Between Color Variables and Number Variables
  3. Provide a Base Color or Number
  4. Add a Collection Name (Optional)
  5. Add to an Existing Collection (Optional)
  6. Save as Variable (Optional) – If unchecked, it will be saved as a color style
  7. Group Name (Optional)

131547.name: Pinner
131547.description:
JUNE 2025 PROMOTION

Unlimited Unlock $2 after Trial (Save $6.00)

--------------------------------------------------------


Seamlessly import your Pinterest boards in Figma


  1. Secret boards supported
  2. Fast and customizable import
  3. Imports highest-res images available
  4. Supports large boards with 500+ pins
  5. Imports pins as an AutoLayout grid
  6. One-time unlock for unlimited imports
131547.release_notes:
Import Settings
------------------------------------
New options allow for custom pin dimensions or automatic framing based on the exact dimensions of original Pinterest pin images.

Persistent Authorization
------------------------------------
The plugin now retains your Pinterest authorization between sessions, so you no longer need to reauthorize each time.

Pinterest Account Management
------------------------------------
You can now unlink your Pinterest account from the plugin, making it easier to switch between multiple accounts as needed.

Additional Improvements
------------------------------------
The interface has been reorganized with separate tabs for Boards and Import Settings to improve usability. Clearer status messages offer better feedback during the import process. Authorization errors and expired tokens are now handled more gracefully with automatic recovery.
131547.tagline: Seamless import your Pinterest boards into Figma

plugins.name: Design Critter 🐛 – Feedback Makes You Better
plugins.description:
AI Feedback on your designs for websites, web apps, mobile apps, emails and more.


How it works:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Select a frame, group or layer you want feedback on
  3. Open the plugin
  4. Select the area of design you want feedback on
  5. Recommended: Add any supporting context on what you're designing, what the user goals are, or specific element you want feedback on
  6. Click Get Feedback
  7. Copy any of the feedback and paste it next in your file so you don't lose it


Most importantly if you have any feedback for us, please email kovacjeremy@gmail.com

plugins.name: Clean Gradients
plugins.description:
Problem:

When using a standard gradient with two colors, if there is a large gap between their tones, the saturation in the middle decreases significantly, and the color in this area may appear grayish-resulting in a «muddy» shade.


Solution:

With just two clicks, the plugin eliminates the «muddy» effect in the middle of the gradient by adding three additional intermediate color stops.


How to use the plugin:

1. The colors for the initial gradient can be taken either from an existing gradient element by selecting it and clicking the «Pick gradient» button or by using the «Color Picker» tool on the left and right of the button.

2. To apply the gradient, select the desired element and click the «Apply gradient» button.
plugins.tagline: Cleans the gradient from «dirt»

121505.name: Clean Gradients
121505.description:
Problem:

When using a standard gradient with two colors, if there is a large gap between their tones, the saturation in the middle decreases significantly, and the color in this area may appear grayish-resulting in a «muddy» shade.


Solution:

With just two clicks, the plugin eliminates the «muddy» effect in the middle of the gradient by adding three additional intermediate color stops.


How to use the plugin:

1. The colors for the initial gradient can be taken either from an existing gradient element by selecting it and clicking the «Pick gradient» button or by using the «Color Picker» tool on the left and right of the button.

2. To apply the gradient, select the desired element and click the «Apply gradient» button.

plugins.name: GradCover
plugins.description:
"Cover Gradient Pro is a Figma plugin crafted specifically for users looking to enhance their design documents with eye-catching gradient covers. Whether it's for branding manuals, product catalogs, or personal portfolios, this plugin assists in swiftly creating professional and visually striking cover designs.


With Cover Gradient Pro, you can expect:


A rich palette of gradient options to diversify your cover design choices.

One-click cover generation to streamline the design process and save valuable time.

Highly customizable gradient features, allowing you to adjust colors and effects to fit your design needs.

Seamless integration with Figma, ensuring your cover designs blend perfectly with your project documents.

To use Cover Gradient Pro, simply select the elements you wish to apply a gradient to, and use the plugin's intuitive controls to choose and adjust your preferred gradient for your cover. Transform your designs with the power of Cover Gradient Pro and give your work the standout cover it deserves."

accepted.name: walden
accepted.description: A UX designer full of whimsical ideas.

plugins.tagline: "Cover Gradient Pro - Add Professional Covers to Your Designs"

113610.name: GradCover
113610.description:
"Cover Gradient Pro is a Figma plugin crafted specifically for users looking to enhance their design documents with eye-catching gradient covers. Whether it's for branding manuals, product catalogs, or personal portfolios, this plugin assists in swiftly creating professional and visually striking cover designs.


With Cover Gradient Pro, you can expect:


A rich palette of gradient options to diversify your cover design choices.

One-click cover generation to streamline the design process and save valuable time.

Highly customizable gradient features, allowing you to adjust colors and effects to fit your design needs.

Seamless integration with Figma, ensuring your cover designs blend perfectly with your project documents.

To use Cover Gradient Pro, simply select the elements you wish to apply a gradient to, and use the plugin's intuitive controls to choose and adjust your preferred gradient for your cover. Transform your designs with the power of Cover Gradient Pro and give your work the standout cover it deserves."
113610.tagline: "Cover Gradient Pro - Add Professional Covers to Your Designs"

plugins.name: Apply variable modes to all pages
plugins.description:
Apply your current page variable modes to all pages of your file!

Perfect for designers and teams working with design tokens, themes, or variable-based workflows.


How to use

1 - Go to a page (or create one) that has the desired variable modes applied

2 - Click "Apply this to all pages" / "Remove modes from all pages"


Done! You have easily copied the variable modes applied to your current page and apply them to all pages in your file with a single click.
plugins.tagline: Apply your current page variable modes to all pages of your file!
